meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Several Bids Expected For Tribune Company The sale of the Tribune Company, whose holdings include The Los Angeles Times, is expected to attract several bidders, including celebrities and the family that once owned the Los Angeles paper. Bids are due tomorrow.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1

Opening Envelopes Hollywood's awards season began with the Golden Globes. ''Babel'' was named best dramatic film; Martin Scorsese won as director of ''The Departed''; Helen Mirren was honored for portrayals of two Queen Elizabeths.
THE ARTS, PAGE E1
Trial in London Bomb Plot Six men appeared in a London court, charged with attempting an attack two weeks after the July 7, 2005, suicide bombings against bus and subway travelers.
PAGE A3
The Warming of Greenland In Greenland, rising temperatures are not only melting ice; they are also changing the very geography, creating islands.
PAGE F1

Voices in My Head Say 'Buy' What is the difference between a tightwad's brain and a spendthrift's brain? John Tierney finds out when he submits himself to the brain scientist's scanner. In his new column and blog (nytimes.com/tierneylab), he explores the frontiers and backwaters of science.
SCIENCE TIMES, PAGE F1

Several Bids Expected For Tribune Company The sale of the Tribune Company, whose holdings include The Los Angeles Times, is expected to attract several bidders, including celebrities and the family that once owned the Los Angeles paper. Bids are due tomorrow.
